title: Virtual Functions
subject: C++ Programming
theory:
Enables Runtime Polymorphism. 
Keyword `virtual` in Base. 
`Base *b = new Derived(); b->show();` calls Derived show() IF virtual. 
**Pure Virtual**: `virtual void f() = 0;` (Abstract Class).

examples.code:
struct Shape { virtual void draw()=0; };
struct Circle : Shape { void draw() { cout << "Circle"; } };

common_mistakes.correction: If deleting Derived via Base pointer, Base destructor MUST be virtual. Else Child destructor not called (Leak).

interview_questions.question: How do virtual functions work?
interview_questions.answer: Using V-Table (Array of function pointers) and V-Ptr (Hidden pointer in object points to table).
